glossary.purpose: Standardized definitions for all PPM module terms with references to related modules and bridge relationships

organisation.definition: A legal entity or business unit that participates in the platform ecosystem. Can be a Platform Owner, Client subscriber, Agency partner, or Affiliate partner. The root entity in the PPM hierarchy for that organization's portfolio management.
organisation.business_context: Organizations establish strategic objectives and allocate resources across their portfolio of investments. They subscribe to platform products and have localization settings applied via bridge relationships.
organisation.technical_note: Every entity in the PPM module must reference a valid organisation via org_id. Localization settings applied via ppm_localization_bridge. Regional settings no longer embedded in entity.

org_type.definition: Classification of organization role in the platform ecosystem

values.platform_owner: Organization that owns and operates the platform, creates products/services
values.client: Organization that subscribes to platform products/services and uses PPM for their own projects
values.agency: Partner organization that provides services to clients using the platform
values.affiliate: Partner organization with referral or revenue-sharing relationship

org_type.business_context: Determines organization's capabilities, access rights, and relationship to products
org_type.technical_note: Enum value that determines which bridge relationships are valid for the organization

portfolio.definition: A collection of programmes, projects, and operational activities grouped together to facilitate effective management and achieve strategic business objectives.
portfolio.business_context: Portfolios align organizational strategy with execution and optimize resource allocation across initiatives.
portfolio.technical_note: Portfolios inherit localization from parent organisation unless explicitly overridden via bridge relationship.

programme.definition: A group of related projects, subsidiary programmes, and programme activities managed in a coordinated manner to obtain benefits not available from managing them individually.
programme.business_context: Programmes deliver transformational change and realize strategic benefits through coordinated project delivery.
programme.technical_note: Programmes bridge strategic intent (portfolio) with tactical execution (projects). Localization cascades from portfolio unless overridden.

project.definition: A temporary endeavour undertaken to create a unique product, service, or result with defined beginning and end dates, specific objectives, and constrained resources.
project.business_context: Projects are the primary execution vehicle for delivering specific outputs within time, cost, and quality constraints.
project.technical_note: Projects are the lowest level in the PPM hierarchy where actual work is performed. Can have independent PBS and WBS. Localization can be overridden at project level for multi-regional delivery.

pbs.definition: Product Breakdown Structure - A hierarchical decomposition of products, deliverables, or services. Can represent products marketed by Platform Owner OR Client organization, OR deliverables from PPM projects.
pbs.business_context: PBS defines WHAT will be delivered. Used for product discovery, marketing, and project deliverable definition. Platform owners use PBS for their product catalog. Client organizations use PBS for their own products/services discovery. Projects use PBS for deliverable breakdown.
pbs.technical_note: PBS is independent of HOW work is done (that's WBS). A PBS node can relate to: (1) Platform product (platform_product_id), (2) Client marketed product (client_product_id), OR (3) Project deliverable (project_id). Can have independent localization per PBS node.
bridge_relationships: Can inherit localization from project/organisation OR override
Links to platform products via product_bridge
Links to client products via product_bridge
Links to project deliverables via project relationship

wbs.definition: Work Breakdown Structure - A hierarchical decomposition of work to be executed by the organization (Platform Owner, Client, Agency, or Affiliate) to accomplish project objectives and create deliverables.
wbs.business_context: WBS defines HOW work will be organized and executed. Each organization type (platform_owner, client, agency, affiliate) maintains their own WBS for work they perform. Used for effort estimation, scheduling, and resource allocation.
wbs.technical_note: WBS is specific to the organization doing the work (org_id). Multiple organizations may have different WBS structures for the same project (e.g., client WBS for their work, agency WBS for their deliverables). Can have independent localization per WBS node for distributed teams.
bridge_relationships: Can override via ppm_localization_bridge per WBS node

stakeholder.definition: An individual, group, or organisation that may affect, be affected by, or perceive itself to be affected by a decision, activity, or outcome of a portfolio, programme, or project.
stakeholder.business_context: Stakeholders have varying levels of authority, interest, and influence in PPM activities and outcomes.
stakeholder.technical_note: Stakeholders are linked to PPM entities through roles and RACI assignments. Can have personal localization preferences that override organizational defaults.
bridge_relationships: Can have personal localization preferences via ppm_localization_bridge

localization_bridge.definition: A graph-style relationship that connects PPM entities to localization configurations, enabling flexible cascade and override of regional settings.
localization_bridge.business_context: Enables granular control of localization settings at any level of the PPM hierarchy, supporting multi-regional and multi-jurisdictional operations.
localization_bridge.technical_note: Graph relationship with precedence rules: entity-specific > parent-inherited > organizational default. See ppm_localization_bridge.json for full specification.

change_control_bridge.definition: A graph-style relationship that connects PPM entities to change control records, enabling comprehensive audit trail and version tracking.
change_control_bridge.business_context: Ensures all modifications to PPM entities, configurations, and relationships are tracked for compliance and governance.
change_control_bridge.technical_note: Graph relationship linking PPM entities to change_control_module. See ppm_change_control_bridge.json for full specification.

financial_value.definition: Monetary amounts in PPM entities (budgets, costs, benefits) stored in base currency (USD) with display currency determined by localization configuration.
financial_value.technical_note: All financial values stored as 'amount_usd' field. Display currency and formatting determined by localization_bridge relationship. No currency fields embedded in PPM entities.

datetime_value.definition: Date and time values in PPM entities stored in ISO 8601 format with UTC offset. Display format and timezone determined by localization configuration.
datetime_value.technical_note: All datetime values stored in ISO 8601 format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ssZ. Display format and timezone conversion determined by localization_bridge relationship. No date_format or timezone fields embedded in PPM entities.

bridge_relationships.description: Organisation can have multiple localization configurations (e.g., headquarters, regional offices)

organisation.definition: The root entity representing a legal entity or business unit that participates in the platform ecosystem. Supports four organization types: platform_owner, client, agency, affiliate. Every PPM entity must belong to an organisation.
organisation.purpose: To provide multi-tenant isolation, establish organizational context, serve as the root for all PPM hierarchies, and define organization role in platform ecosystem.

revision_history.summary: Extracted localization into separate module, added PBS/WBS entities, implemented graph-style bridge relationships for modular architecture
detailed_changes: BREAKING: Removed all embedded localization fields from entities
BREAKING: Extracted platform entity to separate Platform Ontology module
Added org_type enum: platform_owner, client, agency, affiliate
Added Product Breakdown Structure (PBS) entity for WHAT is delivered
Added Work Breakdown Structure (WBS) entity for HOW work is organized

Removed platform entity (moved to separate Platform Ontology)

revision_history.migration_notes: v2.2.0 deployments must migrate to extract embedded localization to separate Localization Module. Migration scripts provided. Estimated effort: 3-5 days per platform.
revision_history.notes: Major architectural refactoring for modularity. PPM now focuses solely on portfolio/programme/project management with PBS/WBS. All localization handled via bridge relationships to separate Localization Module. Enables flexible multi-region, multi-jurisdictional deployments.

revision_history.summary: Added multi-regional support (UK, US, EU) with currency conversion and flexible localization
revision_history.notes: Deprecated in favor of v2.2.1 modular architecture. v2.2.0 had embedded localization which violated separation of concerns.

revision_history.summary: Added change control, platform tracking, and UK localization
Initial self-documenting ontology with examples and best practices

migration_guide_v2_2_0_to_v2_2_1.overview: v2.2.1 is a BREAKING change that refactors embedded localization into separate module with graph-style bridge relationships.
breaking_changes: All localization fields removed from entities (operational_region, display_currency, regional_settings, etc.)
Platform entity moved to separate Platform Ontology module
Change Control entity moved to separate Change Control module
Financial fields renamed to *_usd suffix (e.g., annual_revenue  annual_revenue_usd)
Localization now applied via localization_bridge_refs arrays

migration_steps.details: Install localization_module_v1.0.0.json before migrating PPM data
For each organisation, portfolio, programme, project: extract operational_region, display_currency, regional_settings  create localization config in Localization Module
Create ppm_localization_bridge records linking PPM entities to their localization configs
Rename annual_revenue  annual_revenue_usd, budget  budget_usd, etc.
If using Product/Work Breakdown Structures, create PBS and WBS records
Verify all entities have localization_bridge_refs, dates display correctly, currency converts properly

migration_guide_v2_2_0_to_v2_2_1.rollback_plan: Revert to v2.2.0 schema. Re-embed localization data from Localization Module back into entities. Data integrity maintained as localization extraction is reversible.
